channel.title: mcp on Dwarves Foundation
channel.description: Recent content in mcp on Dwarves Foundation

item.title: Securing your remote MCP servers
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: The AI ecosystem is rapidly evolving beyond isolated systems toward integrated networks of AI models and tools. At the core of this evolution lies the Model Context Protocol (MCP), a standardized communication framework that enables AI systems to interact with external tools and services.

item.title: Tool-Level Security for Remote MCP Servers
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: The Model Context Protocol (MCP) has emerged as a powerful standardized framework for AI-to-tool communication, enabling more sophisticated interactions between LLMs and external systems.

item.title: Intro to Model Context Protocol
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: By making a new protocol known as the Model Context Protocol (MCP) open-source, Anthropic made a major change in AI. By overcoming the limitations of traditional data integration techniques and addressing the recurrent problem of data isolation, this protocol aims to enhance the connections between data hubs and AI systems.
